questions.text: Patient is undergoing endoscopy for epigastric pain. Report shows giant duodenal ulcer in duodenal cap and second one is noted in second part of duodenum. Which investigation should be done next in this patient
questions.solution:
Correct answer is A: Secretin study

  • Secretin study is indicated to diagnose Zollinger-Ellison syndrome, which can present with multiple or giant duodenal ulcers due to excessive gastric acid secretion. It entails fasting gastrin levels and then levels few minutes after secretin injection. 
  • Breath urea test only detects H. pylori infection, not causes of multiple/giant ulcers.
  • Somatostatin scintigraphy identifies neuroendocrine tumors but is not diagnostic for acid hypersecretion.
  • Endoscopic ultrasound visualizes lesions but does not assess gastric secretory function.

questions.text: 30-year-old man is having peptic ulcers refractory to PPI. Work up shows elevated serum calcium. Which of the following investigations will not be useful in assessment of this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct answer is C: Gene sequencing for ret gene

  • The combination of PUD and hypercalcemia makes suspicion of MEN1 in this patient.
  • However, gene sequencing for the RET gene is related to MEN 2 syndrome, which are typically associated with medullary thyroid carcinoma and pheochromocytoma. Therefore, it is not relevant for this patient's assessment.
  • MEN 1 is caused by mutations in the MEN1 gene which encodes the tumor suppressor protein menin. This gene is located on the long arm of chromosome 11 at position 13 (11q13) and consists of 10 exons encoding a 610 amino acid protein.

questions.text: Which of the following is correct about location of ZES

choices.text: Bounded by the duodenum (D2-D3), pancreas, and confluence of the cystic and common bile ducts
Bounded by the duodenum( D2-D3), pancreas, and confluence of the common hepatic and common bile ducts
Bounded by the jejunum, pancreas, and confluence of the cystic and common bile ducts
Bounded by the jejunum, pancreas, and confluence of the common hepatic and common bile ducts

questions.solution:
Correct answer is A: Bounded by the duodenum (D2-D3), pancreas, and confluence of the cystic and common bile ducts

  • The gastrinoma triangle, also known as Passaro's triangle, is an anatomical area in the abdomen where about 90% of gastrinomas arise. Its boundaries can be remembered by the three key anatomical points forming a triangle:
    • Superiorly: Junction of the cystic duct and common bile duct
    • Inferiorly: Junction of the second and third parts of the duodenum
    • Medially: Junction of the neck and body of the pancreas

questions.text: Functional imaging of choice for diagnosis of ZES is?
questions.solution:
Correct answer is A: Ga-68 DOTATE PET-CT

  • Ga-68 DOTATE PET-CT is the imaging modality of choice now for Neuroendocrine tumors and pheochromocytoma with sensitivity > 90%.
